title: Siddhivinayak Temple, Siddhatek
subtitle: The second Ashtavinayak shrine – Lord Ganesha as the Bestower of Success
overview: Siddhivinayak Temple at Siddhatek, located on the banks of the Bhima River in Ahmednagar district, is the second temple in the Ashtavinayak pilgrimage circuit.
It is believed that Lord Vishnu performed penance here to seek Lord Ganesha’s blessings before battling demons, earning this temple its name — Siddhivinayak, the Giver of Success.
The temple is built from black stone, featuring a beautiful shikhara and a serene riverside setting that enhances its divinity.
Devotees undertake a *pradakshina* (circumambulation) of the hill, considered highly meritorious though it spans nearly 5 km.

highlights.title: Swayambhu Idol
highlights.description: The idol of Lord Ganesha is self-manifested, facing north, symbolizing wisdom and prosperity.

highlights.title: Riverside Serenity
highlights.description: Situated beside the Bhima River, the temple offers a tranquil atmosphere ideal for meditation and worship.

geography.intro: Siddhatek is a small village on the Bhima River in Karjat Taluka of Ahmednagar district. The temple sits atop a small hillock surrounded by natural beauty and calm waters.

details.label: Location
details.value: Siddhatek, Karjat Taluka, Ahmednagar District, Maharashtra

climate.description: Siddhatek has a semi-arid climate with hot summers and pleasant winters. The river breeze provides a soothing experience year-round.

seasons.text: Monsoon & Winter (July–February): Ideal for pilgrimage with cool weather and greenery.

geography.conclusion: The temple’s hilltop position and river proximity make it both spiritually uplifting and scenically beautiful.

activities.title: Darshan & Aarti
activities.description: Participate in daily rituals and witness the serene early morning aarti of Lord Siddhivinayak.

activities.title: Pradakshina Path
activities.description: Perform a sacred 5 km circumambulation around the hill, believed to fulfill wishes and remove obstacles.
info: Takes about 1.5 to 2 hours to complete.
Best done early morning before sunrise.

activities.title: River Meditation
activities.description: Spend peaceful time near the Bhima River ghats, ideal for reflection and chanting.

attractions.title: Bhima River Ghats
attractions.description: Scenic and peaceful riverbanks where devotees perform rituals and meditate.

attractions.title: Vishnu Temple Ruins
attractions.description: Ancient remains of a temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, linked with the Ganesha legend.

marineLife.intro: Being an inland shrine, Siddhatek does not have marine life, but its surroundings brim with divine calmness and rural biodiversity.

items.title: Spiritual Vibration
items.description: The temple radiates peace and contentment, enhancing the devotee’s focus and devotion.

items.title: Natural Harmony
items.description: The riverside and surrounding farmlands create a refreshing spiritual environment.

conclusion: Siddhatek’s sanctity and natural charm make it an integral part of Maharashtra’s Ashtavinayak circuit.
The temple unites spirituality and simplicity in perfect balance.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Pune International Airport (120 km).
Taxis and buses available from Pune to Siddhatek.

howToReach.title: By Rail & Road
details: Nearest Railway Station: Daund (18 km) and Ahmadnagar (100 km).
Regular buses from Pune, Daund, and Baramati operate to Siddhatek.

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning or late evening to avoid heat during the 5 km pradakshina.
Book your bus or cab from Pune in advance during festival weekends.
Simple vegetarian meals and prasad are available near the temple complex.
